primary_mission: Messaging Infrastructure Fixes - Rate Limits & Paste Operations
progress_summary: Coordination rate limits increased (Option A - Balanced): 20s min interval, 400/day, 160/8h, 8/60s burst, 10m cooldown
Fixed paste operation deadlock: Removed double-lock in clipboard operations
Enhanced paste reliability: Clipboard verification, multiple focus checks, improved error handling
Tested message delivery to Agent-6: Successfully pasted and delivered
infrastructure_excellence_status: Messaging system rate limits optimized for swarm coordination. Paste operations working reliably with enhanced logging.

blocking_items: None - all fixes verified and working

knowledge_transfers: Rate limit config (Option A): 20s min interval, 400/day, 160/8h, 8/60s burst, 10m cooldown. 8-hour check always-on (not conditional)
Paste deadlock fix: copy_to_clipboard() uses internal locking - don't wrap in additional lock
Enhanced paste logging: INFO-level logs show complete flow (focus → copy → paste → send)
Coordination throttler logic: min_interval → burst → 8h → 24h (correct order)
bugs_fixed: Coordination rate limits too restrictive (5 minutes per pair) - increased to 20 seconds with burst allowance
Paste operation deadlock - double-lock in clipboard operations removed
8-hour rate limit check was conditional - now always-on to prevent spam early
lessons_learned: Rate limits must balance spam prevention with legitimate coordination needs - 5 minutes per pair chokes swarm activity
Double-lock deadlocks are easy to miss - always check if called functions already use locks
Enhanced INFO-level logging critical for debugging paste operations - DEBUG logs not visible in production
deliverables: Coordination rate limits optimized (Option A - Balanced config)
Test verification: Message successfully pasted and delivered to Agent-6
swarm_brain_entry: Coordination rate limits optimized for swarm activity (20s intervals, burst allowance). Paste operation deadlock fixed by removing double-lock in clipboard operations. Enhanced INFO-level logging enables better debugging of paste failures.
